customer_reviews.title: Awesome little camera
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little camera, went from a canon 70D to an a6000 for the size, to the X-T20. This is my favorite camera that I've owned so far. I picked this camera with the 16-50mm because it was all that was in stock at the time, as well as the 35mm F2. I am a beginner / amateur in photography, attached are some pictures that I've taken with this and the 16-50 & 35mm lenses.
customer_reviews.author: ShaneTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Google Before You Buy
customer_reviews.text: Update: 4/11/19 I spent $50 to ship it to NJ to get fixed under warranty. Within a month of having it back and light use, LENS CONTROL ERROR. This camera has caused me to miss every important event in my life the last 6 months of owning it. When I was just outside of the return window, I started getting the dreaded "Lens Control Error". There is absolutely nothing you can do to fix it. I was advised to ship it to New Jersey and see if they can fix it. This means weeks upon weeks without the camera, and it is only 2 months old. SO FRUSTRATING.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this camera and couldn't be more satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this camera and couldn't be more satisfied. The 18-55 lense is heavier than the 16-50 but seems of a much higher quality. The camera is light and super user-friendly. The adjustable screen is a huge bonus as well as the touch-screen capability. Buy another battery, though as one battery won't last a long time out in the field. Look at online reviews and the shots-you'll be stoked to have this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from Fuji XT 10. This is very much a step up. Great focus, touch screen is a nice plus. Ergonomics much better than the XT10. Overall this camera is worth every $$. Picture quality is amazing. Sharp and awesome colors. I definitely recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Jay 1

customer_reviews.title: THIS is what a real image-making machine looks and feels like. Sony, Canon, take notes!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera. After shooting with Canon, and then Sony over the past year, Fujifilm has absolutely blown me away. MUCH better than Canon and especially Sony. Images are beautiful, sharper, even with the 18-55 kit lens. Optical quality from Fuji lenses is amazing, you never have to worry that a Fujinon lens won't be good. Unlike Sony and Canon, every lens Fuji makes is optically superb. Switching to Fuji has been like drinking a cool glass of water after over a year in hell. I'm a believer!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy W. Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Sent it back and got the X-T2... ...
customer_reviews.text: Sent it back and got the X-T2 ... only because I wanted the upgraded EVF ... electronic view finder. Quality of the photos is exactly the same, ie. Fabulous!
customer_reviews.author: Makofoto

customer_reviews.title: As a beginner in photography this camera was exceptionally easy to use
customer_reviews.text: As a beginner in photography this camera was exceptionally easy to use. All of the functions of the camera are intuitive. Also if you are more experienced with other brands of camera you can easily customize this camera's setting to match your old camera. I highly recommend this camera for both the beginner or experienced photographer.
customer_reviews.author: johnnie t beadle

customer_reviews.title: Bought this camera a year ago and still very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking at the X-T3 but there is no need at this point as I am still learning this camera and have not used video capability so much. That will change, and I will likely upgrade to the X-T3 and keep the X-T20 so I can have 2 setups. Very happy with the X-T20 and have had no issues with it in a year's time. The colors are astounding, and the compact size has been great for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Another Review

customer_reviews.title: Replaced Leica system!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sensor for low light work, camera's very compact with great ergonomics! Viewfinder just OK - but $1000 less than the X-T2 (which has a better vf, but no built in flash). Flash is VERY controllable - TTL = + or - 2 stops AND manual. Fuji lenses are as good or better than Leica - which I previously (pre-digital) used for similar work (music in clubs, etc) Very quiet, unobtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Mojo Parker

customer_reviews.title: Small Camera, Big Value
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little camera, the image quality is spectacular, if you have big hands it will take some adjustment getting used to the smallness of the camera and the controls. The EVF is not as high quality as the X-T2, and I had to adjust mine to remove a green tint, otherwise for the price of this camera with the 18-55mm f2.8-4 lens is the deal of the year.
customer_reviews.author: Shakey

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the camera now for around 8 months. It is the first high end camera I have bought and after allot of research this was the one to get at the time. Now I would lean to the bigger sensor, but by no means is this one a chump! There are many features to play around with and everyone has to love that old school look and feel. I have used it in cold weather, it was -20F in the attached moon photo. Never had any issues except for the sd card trying to catch up with the camera! Very high res. photos and am excited to take it to seattle later this year!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Jump on this now!
customer_reviews.text: There's just not enough upgrade in the X-T30 to justify the added cost over what this camera AND lens are going for right now. The current price on the lens alone on another New York camera website goes for $700! This is a fantastic savings if you're thinking about getting into the Fuji system!
customer_reviews.author: William R. Kilps

customer_reviews.title: Small, light, fast
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to this camera from a Nikon D3000. I'm very pleased with this product. Took it to a wedding this weekend and shot a ton of candids and videos. Pictures were razor sharp. The camera is so small and light. The video performance in low lighting was exceptional. Response time was extremely fast. I still have a lot of settings to try out on this camera - I'll be exploring the double exposure and panorama features. One con so far: my right hand kept activating the menu because the 4-way buttons are so close to the right side. I'll just have to train myself not to grab it that way.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE AT FIRST SHOT
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful compact camera, possibly all you need to enjoy hitting the streets in town or while you travel and return with great photos. I normally shoot with my Olympus cameras, but this one has really stolen my heart. I can't stop shooting with it. At the end of the day you want to shoot with a camera you enjoy and that you can take with you everywhere you go without being burdened by heavy gear. I am shooting with the 18mm lens, and I love the results.
customer_reviews.author: Bestbeast333Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pick for switching to a mirrorless.
customer_reviews.text: I know the X-T30 just came out but this bad boi still packs a punch. I paired mine with a 23mm F2 and am loving every shot. The box came in unscathed as did the camera and lens it came with. My only qualm was that the manual seemed to be used before (the wrapping on it was torn on the bottom and had a hard crease in the book so if you laid it flat it showed the page that describes how to connect the straps to it). I’m worried the camera might’ve been used before and returned although I haven’t found any defects yet.
customer_reviews.author: Shurrie

customer_reviews.title: I love the camera, but it did not come with the USB cord to connect to computer
customer_reviews.text: I am exploring this camera for the first time in my photography course. I've been enjoying it for a couple weeks, roaming around the city taking pictures. The camera itself seems to be good quality, but of course, a few weeks in I go to transfer the contents of my memory card to my computer to experiment with editing, and I realize my camera did not include a USB cord to connect to the computer. Not sure if this was a mistake on the part of the seller, or if this is standard for this product. Either way, it's a pretty critical component for any photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is lightweight but not so small that you can't find the buttons. I really like it & pretty quality is good. I think they consider it an entry level but I like it much better than the newer x-t3 with too many bells & whistles. I wish camera companies would consider this customers who want simplicity but can get the best image quality available and cannot afford a Leica. Camera works beautifully with 23mm f/23 lens. Highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Quality Rules

customer_reviews.title: Great first camera
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted a camera for 4 years and finally pulled the trigger with this camera. I’m a noobie and know a few things about photography but then again I do not. This is the perfect mirorless camera that is suitable for a wide range of photography. I just received the camera 4 days ago and cannot stop touching it. I took the 55-200mm lens and then I also bought the Fujifilm xF35mm F2 R WR lens and I absolutely love that one very much. I will add pictures of both the 35mm lens and 55-200mm lens.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: i've had the xt2 so the xt20 didn't disappoint. Camera is a little small for my hands, but i knew that going into the purchase so no complaints. The image quality is great, the touch functionality can be updated, but works. The auto focus during video is night and day better than panasonics DTF technology, idk if i can go back The EVF is a downgrade from the xt2, but it won't be missed knowing this camera is cheaper and more portable.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camera
customer_reviews.text: You can find lots of reviews (test and video) online, here I just wanted to rate the product in general. It works for lazy/beginners due to variety of options in Auto mode, and the camera has manual control of everything for people interested in taking picture "by hands". I strongly recommend to visit some electronic shop (BestBuy, for example) to try the camera, hold it in YOUR hands before purchasing. In my case, I looked for X-T100, but X-T20 turned to be better for me in all ways.

customer_reviews.title: Packs in the Tech but Keeps it Friendly
customer_reviews.text: For me, this camera has made taking pictures fun again. Love that seeing and adjusting settings is so easy! The digital touch screen, size, weight, features and image / video quality are going to make this camera hard to beat for years to come. (FUJI - please, do more sales on the XF lenses.)
customer_reviews.author: KeoghTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Weight of the lens offsets the lightness of the body
customer_reviews.text: I really like this camera. Takes good images, small, compact. And, although it's not really important, I love the vintage look of the camera itself. My only real issue is with the weight of the lens. I wouldn't really call the lens lightweight at all, and it makes the camera seem very front heavy. It actually made my camera seem just about as heavy as my old canon rebel (with a little 50mm on it). I felt like a bit of an idiot that I didn't even consider how big and heavy the lens might be. Not to say that it's super heavy or anything, just not amazingly light like I was hoping.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: So fun to use...nice size.
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera more than words. It takes beautiful photos and is super fun to use. It reminds me of my old film photography days, but with the added benefit of an amazing live view flip screen! I originally wanted the XT2, but didn't want to spend the money. This camera has the same sensor and almost all the same features! The only difference is the lack of ISO dial, which I programmed onto a back dial. The viewfinder is a little smaller and hard to see, especially if you wear glasses. I use the flip screen most of the time. I LOVE THIS CAMERA.
customer_reviews.author: ah

customer_reviews.title: Overall  value and price is Exceptional!
customer_reviews.text: Camera has been able to handle every condition thrown at it with different scenes and weather not being a problem to overcome. The size and versatility of this camera and lense makes a great field camera for documenting project landscapes and portraits. Also a great travel camera, the very small body made it easy to carry around under my rain jacket in a case. Same setup I used for work in wildlands worked well on my last trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Upgrading from a Canon T3i....
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this camera for a couple weeks. It took amazing pictures right out of the box with the 18-55 lens. The JPEG images straight out of the camera are good to go. It captures so much more detail than my T3i and the controls and options are a lot of fun to use. Even at 2.8 it takes better indoor shots than my old T3i with a opened up to 1.8.... must be the higher ISOs available coupled with the improved processor. Take it outside and the colors are just impressive. Selling my Canon stuff and not looking back.
customer_reviews.author: MamaToTwo

customer_reviews.title: A "regular guy" review!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a "regular" person who enjoys great photos (as opposed to a pro who gives an in-depth, no-holds-barred review) and did my regular research into the mirror less cameras available at a reasonable price. I looked at several from the major camera companies and found the Fujifilm camera to be a wonderful choice. At this point I am still using the camera mostly on auto settings and just starting to venture into the manual settings that I know will greatly enhance my picture taking. The pics so far are great and I'm very pleased and highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Hawk Shaw

customer_reviews.title: High quality, full featured, but easy to use, very small so grip issues may be of concern
customer_reviews.text: Amazing how a camera with such great features and quality can be so small. I upgraded from an X-T10 which I'll hold on to -- and got a sensor with more resolution -- hopefully, crops of shots will be sharper. Just started to use it -- these are pretty much the first shots out of the box -- taken using my FujiFilm 18-55mm lens. Small size makes it easier to bring along -- so i expect to get a lot of use out of my X-T20 over the summer and fall. This camera is a very good choice for anyone whose back and shoulders don't like hauling around a full-frame DSLR.

I am very happy with this investment.

I tried to learn how to get around the accidental presses but couldn't help myself when I was working fast with the camera. The auto focus was a little less forgiving than I expected and would take a couple tries to focus on the points that I really wanted. Overall this is a very nice camera but comes with its expected flaws

customer_reviews.title: This camera is great in so many ways
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great in so many ways, specially image quality, but boy this thing is slow to operate. There is not enough processing power in it. My older gx85 crushes it. Extremely fast and a joy to use. For $1200 I'd expect more, a lot more from fuji on processing power. I'm using 90mbs read and 60 write and yet it takes 2 seconds to review the picture. If you like taking pictures one right after the other, forget it. This is going to get you very frustrated. Otherwise it has a great kit lens, very nice menu.

customer_reviews.text: Great camera, rivals any DSLR I have ever used. Only down side so far to it is that the hand grip for my right hand has no room. Basically I am constantly hitting the buttons with the thumb part of my palm while trying to take pictures. This brings up a sync option for what I think is the flash. It's happened a lot while getting ready to take a photo using the EFV. Eventually I will learn to pay more attention to where my palm is at in relation to the camera and I think that issue will die down a lot. This camera is just remarkable though.
